text: Florida State Representatives including Edward Bullard and Wilbert Holloway conferring in background Wilbert "Tee" Theodore Holloway (born August 3, 1948) is a former member of the Miami-Dade County School Board and a former member of the Florida House of Representatives. He was appointed to the Miami-Dade County School Board by then-Governor Charlie Crist in 2007. He was born in Miami and graduated from Miami Northwestern Senior High School in 1966. He has a B.S. in Business Administration from Bethune-Cookman University. He married Linda Hodges and has four children. He served in the Florida House from 2001 until 2007. He is Baptist. Florida Memory has a photo of him with Will Kendrick on the House floor in 2007. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:Members of the Florida House of Representatives Category:Bethune–Cookman University alumni Category:21st- century Baptists Category:Baptists from Florida Category:Florida Democrats Category:School board members in Florida Category:21st-century American politicians
title: Wilbert Holloway
